Participants.evidence: Patients with Clinical-Etiology-Anatomy-Pathophysiology (CEAP) C2-C6 with truncal reflux were prospectively included.

Intervention.evidence: Venous interventions were used to treat reflux and varicosities.

Objective.evidence: Therefore, we aimed to translate the Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire into Thai language (AVVQ-Thai) and evaluate its reliability and validity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: AVVQ-Thai were collected pre- and one-month post-intervention.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median AVVQ scores improved significantly after intervention from 15.4 (IQR 8.3, 24.2) to 4.2 (IQR 1.3, 8.4) in C2-C3, and 18.9 (IQR 14.1, 25.5) to 7.3 (IQR 4.6, 16.3) in C4-C6.
